did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Edward Devereux papers, ca.1936-1978
did.physdesc: Correspondence, publications, course material, subject files.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Includes correspondence, publications, course material and subject files pertaining to Devereux's interest in the ways families are organized cross-culturally and historically and how these variations affect child rearing, with reference to these subjects in Japan, Germany, Israel and England. Also files on gambling, the juvenile courts in Tompkins County, children's games, in particular Little League, and correspondence concerning his documentary film "Two Ball Games."

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Edward Devereux was Professor of Human Development and Human Studies at Cornell University from 1950-1978.

Edward Devereux was born in Long Island, New York in 1912. He received his A.B. and Ph.D. degrees in Sociology from Harvard in 1940. After two years as a Sociology Instructor at the University of Toronto, Devereux entered the U.S. Navy as a navigator and executive officer on a fleet tanker until 1945. He was then appointed Assistant Professor of Sociology at Princeton for five years, before joining the Cornell University faculty as Associate Professor of Child Development and Family Studies in 1950, serving as Department Chair from 1966-1970.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence, publications, course material and subject files pertaining to Devereux's interest in the ways families are organized cross-culturally and historically and how these variations affect child rearing, with reference to these subjects in Japan, Germany, Israel and England. Also files on gambling, the juvenile courts in Tompkins County, children's games, in particular Little League, and correspondence concerning his documentary film "Two Ball Games."

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.corpname: New York State College of Human Ecology-- Department of Human Development and Family Studies.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions:
accessrestrict.p: Box 1, folders 20-22 are restricted until 2026, folder 51 is restricted until 2046 at which time the restrictions will be reevaluated.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Edward Devereux Papers #23-13-3191. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

relatedmaterial.head: RELATED MATERIAL
relatedmaterial.p: A DVD of the two copies of the film "Two Ball Games" can be found in collection #21-36-2566, box 24
